item.title: Covid: Vaccine should be given to 12 to 15-year-olds
item.description: Move will help reduce school disruption - but only one dose to be offered, top doctors say.

item.title: Covid: More than 300,000 suspected of breaking quarantine rules
item.description: It comes as the prime minister prepares to announce his winter Covid plan, including for booster jabs.

item.title: Galleri cancer test: What is it and who can get it?
item.description: Volunteers are being recruited in England for a blood test able to detect more than 50 types of cancer.

item.title: UK scraps Covid-19 vaccine deal with French firm Valneva
item.description: The French firm says the deal was cancelled over allegations of a breach of the agreement, which it denies.

item.title: British American Tobacco negotiated bribe for Mugabe, new evidence suggests
item.description: Documents reveal British American Tobacco’s role in bribery and spying in southern Africa.

item.title: M25 junctions blocked by Insulate Britain campaigners
item.description: Police make more than 40 arrests at a series of co-ordinated protests around the motorway.

item.title: Apple iPhone risk from powerful motorbike vibrations
item.description: Camera performance can "degrade" if attached to high-volume, high-power motorbikes, Apple says.

item.title: Britney Spears announces engagement to Sam Asghari
item.description: The singer, who is fighting a legal battle over her conservatorship, met fiancé Sam Asghari in 2016.

item.title: Afghanistan: UN seeks millions in international aid
item.description: It is seeking more than $600m (£434m) in aid following the Taliban takeover last month.

item.title: Primark says leggings still popular as comfort rules
item.description: The discount fashion chain says shoppers are still stocking up on cycle shorts and seam-free clothes.

item.title: Warning on teachers' lack of Holocaust knowledge
item.description: Many teachers do not know enough about the Holocaust to combat myths and falsehoods, a study suggests.

item.title: Tanya Fear: British actress reported missing in LA
item.description: Tanya Fear, 31, who has appeared in Doctor Who, has not been seen since last week.

item.title: Ashley Cain urges men dealing with grief to 'talk about it'
item.description: Ashley Cain urges men dealing with bereavement to "talk about it" after the loss of his eight-month-old daughter to leukaemia.

item.title: Garden photography reveals a world of hedgehogs and foxes
item.description: Ola Maddams used a remote camera to capture natural scenes in her garden.

item.title: Festivals: Period facilities are needed at live events
item.description: Menstruating at lives event can be "dehumanising and daunting", festival-goers say.

item.title: The first hate-crime attack after 9/11
item.description: The story of the first American to be killed in the backlash - a turbaned Sikh man in Arizona.

item.title: The Biff, Chip and Kipper books adapted into TV show
item.description: From the classroom to the small screen; meet the actors playing Biff, Chip and Kipper.

item.title: Emma Raducanu on being US Open champ, the Queen and chocolate
item.description: Emma Raducanu talks about being US Open champion, her victory treat and her message from the Queen.

item.title: Emma Raducanu set to earn millions after US Open win
item.description: Brands will queuing up to secure sponsorship deals with the teenage tennis star, experts say.

item.title: MTV Awards 2021: More sparks fly on red carpet than on stage
item.description: After a scuffle on the red carpet, the ceremony struggles to generate many big new cultural moments.

item.title: The epicentre of Britain's pandemic house price boom
item.description: House prices have surged in many parts of the UK - and in one district they have risen by 29% in a year.

item.title: Jesse Lingard takes control of a Rainbow Six Siege esports team
item.description: The footballer believes his experiences on the pitch will translate to the online world.

item.title: The pressures - and rewards - of being an influencer
item.description: Running your own popular YouTube channel can be lucrative, but it comes with downsides.

item.title: Richard Osman: Trying to make the world a better place
item.description: The TV star and author shares his life lessons on regret, ageing and doing good.

item.title: Daniil Medvedev: US Open champion finally celebrates - and says title is anniversary present for his wife
item.description: Winning his first Grand Slam at the US Open was enough for Daniil Medvedev to finally celebrate - and he pulled out a move from a video game.

item.title: India appointed three top women judges. Is it too early to celebrate?
item.description: Appointment of three women to India's Supreme Court is being hailed as a "historic moment".

item.title: Kenyan influencers paid to take 'guerrilla warfare’ online
item.description: Shadowy financiers are closing down a once democratic space on Twitter for political debate in Kenya.

item.title: Women's state pension: 'It is like you've lived one big lie'
item.description: How women born in the 1950s had their retirement plans upended by state pension age changes.

item.title: Arsenal to face holders Barcelona in Women's Champions League group, Chelsea drawn with Wolfsburg
item.description: Chelsea face Wolfsburg in the Women's Champions League group stages, with Arsenal in with holders Barcelona.

item.title: I need to fight Fury, boxing needs it - Joshua
item.description: Anthony Joshua says he needs to fight heavyweight rival Tyson Fury before he retires.

item.title: Raikkonen fit to return for Russian Grand Prix
item.description: Alfa Romeo driver Kimi Raikkonen is set to return to racing at the Russian Grand Prix after recovering from coronavirus.

item.title: 'I will be fit for Ashes' - Australia captain Paine to have neck surgery
item.description: Australia Test captain Tim Paine is confident he will be fit for the Ashes despite needing surgery to treat a pinched nerve in his neck.

item.title: US Open highlights: Emma Raducanu beats Leylah Fernandez to win maiden Grand Slam
item.description: Watch the best shots as Emma Raducanu wins the women's US Open to become the first British female winner at Flushing Meadows since Virginia Wade in 1968 and the first qualifier in the Open era to win a Slam.

item.title: Mohamed Salah: Liverpool star's best goals & stats as Salah joins Premier League 100-goal club
item.description: As Mohamed Salah reaches 100 Premier League goals, BBC Sport looks back at some of his best goals and the key stats of how the Liverpool forward reached the landmark.

item.title: Flu jab 2021: Who’s eligible for a free vaccine?
item.description: This year's roll out has expanded in an attempt to shield against a double whammy of flu and Covid.

item.title: Covid passports: How do I get one and when will I need it?
item.description: People in Scotland will need to be fully vaccinated to go to clubs, sporting events and concerts.

item.title: Covid: Will I need a jab and what will university be like this term?
item.description: Many Covid restrictions have been lifted for students going to university this term.

item.title: Covid symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: A new cough, fever and change in smell or taste are the key symptoms that mean you may have coronavirus.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Stamp duty holiday: How much do I have to pay now?
item.description: Stamp duty rules are changing in England and Northern Ireland

item.title: Covid: How do I get the vaccine and will I need a booster?
item.description: A third dose is being offered to up to half a million people in the UK with weakened immune systems.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The progress made in vaccinating the country's population, as more than 48 million people have received at least one dose.

item.title: Universal credit: When will the £20 increase stop?
item.description: The government has confirmed the £20 boost will end in the autumn.

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: Significant numbers have had long-term problems after recovering from the original infection.

item.title: Back to school: How are pupils being kept Covid-safe?
item.description: Many children are returning to school after the holidays, while Scottish pupils already returned.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland?
item.description: Lockdown rules are changing across the UK, but some restrictions remain in place.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Millions of children, including 16- to 17-year-olds, are now being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: A traffic light system is in place setting out rules for entering the UK

item.title: Covid: How is furlough changing and when will it end?
item.description: The furlough scheme, which protected millions of jobs during the pandemic, is in its final weeks.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in other parts of the UK.

item.title: Raducanu: US Open champion celebrated in China for her heritage
item.description: Many in China have been quick to point out the 18-year-old's half-Chinese heritage.

item.title: Emma Raducanu: Young players 'inspired' by her win
item.description: Young tennis players have been inspired by Emma Raducanu, the 18-year-old Grand Slam winner.

item.title: Emma Raducanu: Where does teenager's win rank among British triumphs?
item.description: Where does teenager Emma Raducanu's historic US Open victory rank among great British sporting moments?

item.title: Emma Raducanu: US Open champion's mental strength is truly special, says coach
item.description: Andrew Richardson, the coach who guided Emma Raducanu to her astonishing US Open triumph, says her mental strength is "truly special".

item.title: It means everything - Raducanu on US Open win
item.description: Emma Raducanu says she does not want to let go of the US Open trophy as her fairy tale in New York culminates in the ultimate happy ending.

item.title: Queen praises Raducanu's 'outstanding' performance
item.description: The Queen leads the congratulations to Emma Raducanu after the 18-year-old Briton clinches the US Open title with victory against Leylah Fernandez.

item.title: Emma Raducanu: US Open champion can inspire more women and girls into sport
item.description: Campaigners believe Emma Raducanu's US Open success can help inspire more women and girls into taking up sport

item.title: Emma Raducanu's hometown celebrates win
item.description: This is how people in Bromley, London – including her former tennis coach – reacted to the result.

item.title: Emma Raducanu: The making of Great Britain's US Open champion
item.description: As British teenager Emma Raducanu wins the US Open, BBC Sport charts her rapid rise - with the help of a host of experts.

item.title: ‘Havana syndrome ’ and the mystery of the microwaves
item.description: The BBC investigates a mystery illness dubbed "Havana syndrome" that has affected American diplomats and spies.

item.title: Chaos and confusion: The frenzied final hours of the Afghan government
item.description: Through interviews with insiders, BBC News has pieced together an account of how Afghanistan’s government unravelled.

item.title: The hard men removing squatters in Spain
item.description: Some squatters in Spain demand cash before leaving - so eviction firms have arisen to handle the talks.

item.title: Afghanistan: Shukria Barakzai's whispered voice notes and dramatic escape
item.description: The desperate messages sent by Afghan politician Shukria Barakzai to a UK MP as the Taliban tried to hunt her down.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'undefeated' Panjshir Valley - an hour from Kabul
item.description: The Panjshir Valley has been a flashpoint in Afghanistan's turbulent history - now it's happening again.
